name: WASP-185
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-185 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-185 is a star with 1.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.5 times its radius. It is located 896.929 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-185 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-185 system

WASP-185 b

WASP-185 b was discovered by the WASP-South observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-185 b is 311.4734 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-185 b is 14.011 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-185 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-185 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-185, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by WASP-South.
